text: - hey musical scientists I've been
feeling like I need to try something new
I've been doing musical science on this
channel for close to five years now and
it's been incredible you have been
incredibly supportive fans you've
commented how much you love the things
I'm putting out and it's given me this
opportunity to stick in both of the
fields that I love both expanding my
knowledge of science and different
fields that I never would have gotten to
study necessarily and expanding my love
of music and music production and video
production it's really a dream career
and I wouldn't I would never stop doing
this but at the same time I've been
finding that there's a little bit of a
gap between what I would like to be
saying and how much I can actually say
the format of a science song is fairly
restrictive you've got a certain number
of bars with a certain number of words
with a very particular rhythm and rhyme
scheme and all that's really important
to get right in order to convey the
musicality and the rhythm and the feel
of a song that means that you have to
make that I have to make a lot of
restrictive choices on what information
I can include in a song and what bits
I've learned that might be fascinating
and interesting and I want to
communicate to you but end up on the
cutting room floor because I can't fit
them into the very constrained puzzle
that is making one of these pieces and
I've been noticing at the same time that
the media I actually consume now is much
less three to four minutes very quick
summaries I've become more interested in
conversations and in long-form content
and listening to podcasts and watching
interviews and really being able to
follow the thread of a conversation and
of a line of reasoning as far as it can
possibly go so I've been thinking about
that for a while and I thought well if
that's the sort of thing I'm consuming
why shouldn't I also be trying to make
that so what I've decided to do is that
every once in a while I'm going to
release these longer form videos and
I'll also be releasing this as a podcast
we'll be calling this science life and
what we're going to do is I'm going to
try to have interesting conversations
with people who really understand a
certain field of science or you have an
interesting take on the world of either
a subset of science or
converging science with media or with
music I'm just going to try to find the
most interesting people I can to have
fascinating conversations and then I'll
be putting those conversations on the
internet both as a podcast and on this
YouTube channel I'm still going to be
making songs and a cappella videos don't
worry about that this channel is a
capella science it's going to stay that
but I'm really hoping that this new
series I'm starting will be a way to
bridge that gap between how much I'm
able to learn and how much I want to
communicate and how much I've actually
been communicating and at the same time
that it will be a great source of
inspiration and new knowledge that I can
take these conversations and maybe
package them in song form and that
you'll already understand then more of
the context and you'll actually be able
to appreciate these works of art that
I'm doing even better so that's the hope
we'll see if it plays out but this is an
experiment for now I hope you'll come
along with me we're the spice for the
flavor
haha
[Music]
you
[Music]
